title: Environmental data from aquaculture
text:
Environmental data displayed in this repository has been collected at aquaculture locations throughout Puget sound as part of an ongoing project. Data displayed here has not been quality controlled. Suggestions for additions or alterations to this page please contact Craig Norrie - cnorrie@uw.edu


Click each location on this map to find a list of the data that has been collected at each site and the organisation that has collected this data.









The following figures allow the comparison of data across all sites over the duration that the data was collected.


At intertidal sites, these daily averages include time that the sensors were not in the water.









Note that these daily averages include time that individuals were out of the water at low tide sites.

title: Environmental data from aquaculture
text: Click each location on this map to find a list of the data that has been collected at each site and the organisation that has collected this data.

title: Thorndyke Bay environmental data
text: Thorndyke Bay monitoring instruments are located within the Baywater Shellfish shellfish farm. Baywater shellfish is an intertidal shellfish farm. Environmental monitoring instruments are located on oyster lines that are anchored into the ground and are exposed every tidal cycle.

title: Thorndyke Bay environmental data
text:
Temperature data
Temperature data was collected from hobo DO and temp logger. Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated. Note this data included information from when individuals were out of the water. 






#PSI temperature

title: Thorndyke Bay environmental data
text:
Disolved oxygen data
Dissolved oxygen data was collected using a hobo DO and temp logger. Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated. Note this data included information from when sensors were emersed.







#carbchem %>% filter(Site == "Thorndyke") %>% select(-c(1,2)) %>%  arrange(Year, Month)

title: Hood Head environmental data
text: Hood Head site is located within Blue Dot Sea Farm. Blue Dot Sea Farm is a subtidal shellfish and seaweed farm. Environmental monitoring instruments are deployed on hanging SEAPA oyster cages or suspended directly from backbone lines.

title: Hood Head environmental data
text:
Site information






Here will be a link to the raw data

title: Hood Head environmental data
text:
Temperature data
Temperature data was collected from hobo DO and temp logger. Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated.
The hobo logger was lost from this stite between August and October.

title: Hood Head environmental data
text:
Disolved oxygen data
Dissolved oxygen data was collected using a hobo DO and temp logger. Data was collected every 15 minutes and daily averages were calculated.







#carbchem %>% filter(Site == "Hood Head") %>% select(-c(1,2)) %>%  arrange(Year, Month)

title: Totten Inlet environmental data
text:
This site is located in South Puget Sound. Environmental data is collected from an intertidal shellfish farm. Sensors were attached in the intertidal zone at a tidal height of 0 m. Data was collected by Pacific Shellfish Institute. Contact (Andy Suhrbier)[suhrbier@pacshell.org] for mor info.










ggplotly(tottenallplot)
